main event: A pilot and civilians in the Shreveport, Louisiana area observed multiple unidentified flying objects on January 31, 1953.
interesting points: Three of the objects suddenly vanished while two remained in the area, moving rapidly and making maneuvers with high angular speed.
The remaining object continued its maneuvers for approximately two hours.
The objects were observed at a maximum altitude of around 4,000 feet, moving from northeast to southwest.
The sighting lasted for a total duration of 2 hours.
No sound was recorded from the objects.
sighted object: Oval-shaped objects with possible exhaust or vapor trails
witnesses: Pilot of a fishing party and civilians in the area
